edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.server.Controllers

Class LobbyController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.server.Controllers.ServiceController
      • edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.server.Controllers.ChatController
        • edu.ucsb.cs56.games.client_server.v2.server.Controllers.LobbyController

  • public class LobbyController
extends ChatController
    Since all clients need an "active service" to be connected to, which listens to input, lobby service is a service that extends chat service and does little else. quite honestly, it doesn't do much else besides extend chatservice, so its existence is largely pointless
    Version:
    for CS56, Spring 2013
    Author:
    Joseph Colicchio, Adam Ehrlich
